title: Memory leak with V3.0.0 iOS SDK
body:
I've noticed a memory leak while using `MGLMapView` within a navigation controller.

To Recreate:
1) Create 2 view controllers in a navigation controller, with VC A segueing to VC B, containing a `MGLMapView`.
2) Go back to the original view controller, VC B is deinitialized but memory is not freed at all.

Instruments:

![screen shot 2015-11-25 at 3 09 10 pm](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/12078810/11408351/87235d9c-9386-11e5-8976-dec68c64aac7.png)
bodyHTML:
I've noticed a memory leak while using MGLMapView within a navigation controller.

To Recreate:

  1. Create 2 view controllers in a navigation controller, with VC A segueing to VC B, containing a MGLMapView.
  2. Go back to the original view controller, VC B is deinitialized but memory is not freed at all.

Instruments:
bodyText:
I've noticed a memory leak while using MGLMapView within a navigation controller.
To Recreate:

Create 2 view controllers in a navigation controller, with VC A segueing to VC B, containing a MGLMapView.
Go back to the original view controller, VC B is deinitialized but memory is not freed at all.

Instruments:

node.body: @adam-mapbox, `SpriteAtlas` is being leaked. Would #3049 address this issue?
node.bodyText: @adam-mapbox, SpriteAtlas is being leaked. Would #3049 address this issue?
node.bodyHTML: @adam-mapbox, SpriteAtlas is being leaked. Would #3049 address this issue?

bodyParsed.sent: @adam-mapbox, SpriteAtlas is being leaked.
Would #3049 address this issue?

node.body: I'm not sure.  If anything, https://github.com/mapbox/mapbox-gl-native/compare/tmpsantos-1488_annotations_survive_style_change would perhaps fix it; but I think that only deals with leaking the SpriteAtlas that was created for that PR.  So it wouldn't fix existing issues.  It makes me think though that something very similar to what @tmpsantos fixed for #3049 is going on here.

So it wouldn't fix existing issues.
It makes me think though that something very similar to what @tmpsantos fixed for #3049 is going on here.

node.body: To install this weekend's prerelease via CocoaPods, point your Podfile to [this Podspec](https://github.com/mapbox/mapbox-gl-native/blob/ios-v3.1.0-pre.1/ios/Mapbox-iOS-SDK.podspec). Note that, if you use Swift, you may run into #3300, which will be fixed in the next prerelease.

node.body: @chriszhang4213, you can obtain a Bitcode-free binary by [building from source](https://github.com/mapbox/mapbox-gl-native/blob/master/platform/ios/DEVELOPING.md) (`make ipackage BITCODE=NO`). I’m curious what’s preventing you from adopting Bitcode in your project. Is it a particular third-party framework, perhaps, or iOS 7 support?
node.bodyText: @chriszhang4213, you can obtain a Bitcode-free binary by building from source (make ipackage BITCODE=NO). I’m curious what’s preventing you from adopting Bitcode in your project. Is it a particular third-party framework, perhaps, or iOS 7 support?
node.bodyHTML: @chriszhang4213, you can obtain a Bitcode-free binary by building from source (make ipackage BITCODE=NO). I’m curious what’s preventing you from adopting Bitcode in your project. Is it a particular third-party framework, perhaps, or iOS 7 support?

I’m curious what’s preventing you from adopting Bitcode in your project.
Is it a particular third-party framework, perhaps, or iOS 7 support?

node.body:
@1ec5 @friedbunny . ok, we did use some third-party framework. I am new in this part. when I download the 3.01 I follow the guide https://www.mapbox.com/ios-sdk/#binary  which is working fine on my project. then I feel like you guys didn't put new release on that download link, so i went to the Pre-release 3.1 and download the dynamic framework instead of a static library. follow the read me.txt guide ...trying to make  this work in my testing project.

then it shows #import "Mapbox.h" file not found...

---

never mind, i just figure out i should use #import < Mapbox/Mapbox.h > instead of "Mapbox.h", it works now..

node.body: I am using the latest Mapbox iOS SDK and I am still experiencing memory leaks. I have a table where you can select a location and when you tap on item, it will go to a map to display the location. When I go back and forth, the memory keeps adding up and my app crashes.

node.body: @jasonlosito, it's likely that the memory leak you're experiencing is distinct from the issue that was reported here and long ago fixed. Please open a new issue, and be sure to link to an instruments trace and/or sample code that reproduces the problem, so we can be sure we're looking at the same thing as you are. Thank you!

bodyParsed.sent: Tracking in #7991.
I've noticed a memory leak while using MGLMapView within a navigation controller.
To Recreate:
Create 2 view controllers in a navigation controller, with VC A segueing to VC B, containing a MGLMapView.
Go back to the original view controller, VC B is deinitialized but memory is not freed at all.
Instruments:
